sen.j: 宇太水分神社（うだみくまりじんじゃ）は、奈良県宇陀市にある神社。
sen.e: Udamikumari-jinja Shrine is located in Uda City, Nara Prefecture.
Udamikumari-jinja Shrine is located in Uda City, Nara Prefecture.
Udamikumari-jinja Shrine is located in Uda City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 芳野（上社）・古市場（中社）、下井足（下社）の3社がある。
sen.e: There are three shrines: Yoshino (Kamisha), Furuichiba (Chusha) and Shimoidani (Shimosha).
There are three shrines: Yoshino (Upper or 'Kamisha'), Furuichiba (Middle or 'Chusha') and Shimoidani (Lower or 'Shimosha').
sen.cmt: 上社などをupper, middle, lowerのように解釈してみました。
sen.e: There are three shrines: Yoshino (Upper or 'Kamisha'), Furuichiba (Middle or 'Chusha') and Shimoidani (Lower or 'Shimosha').

sen.j: 古市場の由緒によると、創立は崇神天皇の時代で、大和の東西南北に祀られた水分のうち東に当たるのが中社とされる。
sen.e: According to Furuichiba's history, the shrine was established in the reign of Emperor Sujin and Mikumari was enshrined in the northern, southern, western and eastern (Chusha) part of Yamato Province.

According to Furuichiba's history, the shrine was established during the reign of Emperor Sujin, and Mikumari, who was worshipped all over the Yamato Province was enshrined in this Middle Shrine in the East.
sen.cmt: in > during. northern, southern,western and eastern > all over the. Chusha > middle shrine in the East.
sen.e: According to Furuichiba's history, the shrine was established during the reign of Emperor Sujin, and Mikumari, who was worshipped all over the Yamato Province was enshrined in this Middle Shrine in the East.

sen.j: 2003年の社殿の塗り替えの時にわずかに残された色彩が発見されそれを元に復元された。
sen.e: The shrine was restored based on the color barely left found when it was repainted in 2003.
When it was repainted in 2003, minute traces of colour were discovered which were used to restore it to its former glory.
sen.cmt: 順番を変更し、barely left > minute traces. based on > which were used.
sen.e: When it was repainted in 2003, minute traces of colour were discovered which were used to restore it to its former glory.
There are three main shrine buildings
There are three main shrine buildings.
sen.cmt: 文末にピリオドを付けました。

sen.e: Three identical buildings stand in a row.
Three identical buildings stand in a row.

sen.j: 第一殿の棟木に元応2年（1320年）の墨書があり、他の2棟も同時の建立と推定される。
sen.e: The first shrine's ridgepole has 1320 inscribed, so the other two shrines are also assumed to have been built in 1320.
The year 1320 is inscribed on the first shrine's ridgepole, so the other two shrines are also assumed to have been built in 1320.
sen.cmt: inscribedを受動態に変更しました。
sen.e: The year 1320 is inscribed on the first shrine's ridgepole, so the other two shrines are also assumed to have been built in 1320.
All three buildings are built in Kasuga-zukuri style (a style of shrine architecture employed in main sanctuaries, which has the same basic form as that of the Kasuga Taisha Shrine).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: All three buildings are built in Kasuga-zukuri style (a style of shrine architecture employed in main sanctuaries, which has the same basic form as that of the Kasuga Taisha Shrine).
All three buildings are built in Kasuga-zukuri style (a style of shrine architecture employed in main sanctuaries, which has the same basic form as that of the Kasuga Taisha Shrine).

sen.j: 隅木入春日造で建立年代の明らかなものとしては最古のものである。
sen.e: They are the oldest of the Sumigiiri Kasuga-zukuri style buildings whose years of establishment are clear.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They are the oldest of all Sumigiiri Kasuga-zukuri style buildings with confirmed dates of construction.
sen.cmt: years of establishment are clear > confirmed dates of construction.
sen.e: They are the oldest of all Sumigiiri Kasuga-zukuri style buildings with confirmed dates of construction.

sen.j: 奈良県宇陀市菟田野区古市場244-3
sen.e: 244-3 Furuichiba, Utano Ward, Uda City, Nara Prefecture
244-3 Furuichiba, Utano Ward, Uda City, Nara Prefecture
244-3 Furuichiba, Utano Ward, Uda City, Nara Prefecture

sen.j: バス：奈良交通バス古市場水分神社前下車
sen.e: Bus: Take the Nara Kotsu Bus to Furuichiba Mikumari-jinja Mae.
Bus: Take the Nara Kotsu Bus to Furuichiba Mikumari-jinja Mae.
Bus: Take the Nara Kotsu Bus to Furuichiba Mikumari-jinja Mae.
